TakeProfit.profit: The target profit in percent. Once your open position reaches this profit it will be closed.
TakeProfit.updateTrailingStop: optional, default true - True means the setback value is used as trailing stop. False means it is set to a fixed rate once when opening a position.
TakeProfit.time: optional, default 0 - After the price falls below your profit target again start a countdown of x seconds before closing the position. The countdown gets reset if the price moves above our profit target before the counter reaches 0 seconds.
TakeProfit.reduceTimeByVolatility: optional, default true - Reduce the stop time during high volatility market moments (by a divisor between 1 and 2 computed from Bollinger Bandwidth).
TakeProfit.trailingStopPerc: trailingStopPerc: number; // optional, default 0.0% (0 = trade immediately) - The trailing stop percentage that will be placed once the computed profit target of the strategy has been reached.
TakeProfit.keepTrendOpen: optional, default true - Don't close if the last candle moved in our direction (only applicable with 'time' and 'candleSize' being set).
TakeProfit.forceMaker: optional, default false - Only place a maker order (not paying the higher taker fee). Order will get adjusted in case the price moves away from it.
TakeProfit.minRate: optional, default 0 (disabled) - Only take profit once this market rate has been reached. Price must be above it for long positions and below it for short positions.
TakeProfit.MAType: optional, default 0 (SMA) - The moving average type of BollingerBands. BollingerBands indicator is being used to determine the market volatility by looking at Bollinger Bandwidth.

TakeProfitPartial.desc: An advanced take profit strategy that can close a position partially. Keeping a part of your position open allows you to get further gains if the market moves in the direction of your position while locking in some of your existing profits. See TakeProfit for a more detailed description.
TakeProfitPartial.percentage: The percentage of the open position to close. Must be between 0 and 100%.
TakeProfitPartial.stop: optional, default 0 (use 'profit' setting) - A fixed stop price when to sell (> for long position) or buy (< for short position). If present takes precedence over 'profit'.
TakeProfitPartial.profit: The target profit in percent. Once your open position reaches this profit it will be closed.
TakeProfitPartial.time: optional, default 0 - After the price falls below your profit target again start a countdown of x seconds before closing the position. The countdown gets reset if the price moves above our profit target before the counter reaches 0 seconds.
TakeProfitPartial.reduceTimeByVolatility: optional, default true - Reduce the stop time during high volatility market moments (by a divisor between 1 and 2 computed from Bollinger Bandwidth).
TakeProfitPartial.trailingStopPerc: trailingStopPerc: number; // optional, default 0.0% (0 = trade immediately) - The trailing stop percentage that will be placed once the computed profit target of the strategy has been reached.
TakeProfitPartial.keepTrendOpen: optional, default true - Don't close if the last candle moved in our direction (only applicable with 'time' and 'candleSize' being set).
TakeProfitPartial.forceMaker: optional, default false - Only place a maker order (not paying the higher taker fee). Order will get adjusted in case the price moves away from it.
TakeProfitPartial.minRate: optional, default 0 (disabled) - Only take profit once this market rate has been reached. Price must be above it for long positions and below it for short positions.
TakeProfitPartial.MAType: optional, default 0 (SMA) - The moving average type of BollingerBands. BollingerBands indicator is being used to determine the market volatility by looking at Bollinger Bandwidth.

TakeProfitStochRSI.desc:
A take profit strategy looking at the Stochastic RSI. It initiates to close a long position at RSI overbought and a short position at RSI oversold. Closing is done by forwarding the order as a stop to an order strategy. Works well with candle sizes of 1h or more and an order strategy running on 1min candles.
good RSI values: TakeProfit at 1h candles on > 87 and < 11
TakeProfitStochRSI.percentage: optional, default 100% - Take profit by partially closing x% of the open position.
TakeProfitStochRSI.interval: The number of candles to use for StochRSI computation.
TakeProfitStochRSI.low: Below this value StochRSI will be considered oversold. This strategy will initiate to close short positions.
TakeProfitStochRSI.high: Above this value StochRSI will be considered overbought. This strategy will initiate to close long positions.
TakeProfitStochRSI.optInFastK_Period: optional, default 5 - The number of candles for the real (not smoothened) StochRSI value.
TakeProfitStochRSI.optInFastD_Period: optional, default 3 - The number of candles for the smoothened StochRSI value. This strategy will use the smoothened StochRSI value for trading.
TakeProfitStochRSI.optInFastD_MAType: optional, default 0 (SMA) - The moving average type to use for smoothening the StochRSI value.
TakeProfitStochRSI.closeRateFactor: optional, default 0.9992 - Move the stop for the closing rate a little bit away from the last price. This multiplies the close rate by this to set the stop below (for shorts 1-x is added).
TakeProfitStochRSI.time: optional, default 0 - After the price falls below your profit target again start a countdown of x seconds before closing the position. The countdown gets reset if the price moves above our profit target before the counter reaches 0 seconds.
TakeProfitStochRSI.keepTrendOpen: optional, default true - Don't close if the last candle moved in our direction (only applicable with 'time' and 'candleSize' being set).
TakeProfitStochRSI.alwaysIncreaseStop: optional, default false - Move the stop closer to the market price after every candle tick of this strategy even if RSI is no more oversold/overbought.
TakeProfitStochRSI.ensureProfit: optional, default true - Check if we still have profit after 'time' has passed. Otherwise don't close the position. Keep in mind that open positions are only being synced every few minutes.
TakeProfitStochRSI.minOpenTicks: optional, default 12 - How many ticks a position shall be open at least before it can be closed. If this strategy uses the same candle size as the main strategy. it's implicitly open at least 1 tick with value 0.

TakeProfitAdvanced.desc:
This is an advanced take profit strategy set which closes a position fully if it is x% in profit and its profit doesn't increase anymore for 5 minutes (configurable).
Additionally it will close 50% of your position if the 1h StochRSI is at its low (for a short position) or at its high (for a long position) - all parameters configurable.
You can optionally add your TradingView.com email address so that WolfBot receives TradingView alerts to trade on them. This allows you to open positions or place additional stops.

TimeOrder.desc: A simple strategy that buys or sells after a specified amount of time has passed. This is useful to place a manual order after the dip of a spike to buy more if you assume this is the start of a new trend. Also useful after a buy from spikes of VolumeSpikeDetector or PriceSpikeDetector.
TimeOrder.executeMin: A countdown in minutes after which the buy/sell order will be executed.
TimeOrder.keepTrendOpen: optional, default true - Don't execute the order yet if the last candle moved in our direction (only applicable with 'candleSize' being set).

TimeStop.desc:
A different kind of close-strategy, similar to a stop-loss strategy. This strategy places a trailing stop after a position was open for a certain amount of candles. It can optionally look at RSI values before closing a position or only close if the position has a profit or loss.
Ideal for daytraders who want to exit the market after a certain amount of time to minimize risks.
TimeStop.minCandles: The minimum number of candles a position has to be open before being closed.
TimeStop.trailingStopPerc: optional, default 0.05% - The trailing stop percentage that will be placed after minCandles have passed.
TimeStop.closePosition: optional, default 'always' - Only close a position if its profit/loss is in that defined state. Values: always|profit|loss
TimeStop.time: optional, default 0 - After the price falls below the trailing stop, start a countdown of x seconds before closing the position. The countdown gets reset if the price moves above the stop before the counter reaches 0 seconds.
TimeStop.keepTrendOpen: optional, default true - Don't close if the last candle moved in our direction (only applicable with 'time' and 'candleSize' being set).
TimeStop.notifyBeforeStopSec: optional, default 0 (disabled) - Send a push notification x seconds before the stop executes.
TimeStop.interval: optional, default 9 - The number of candles to use for RSI computation.
TimeStop.low: optional, default 0 (disabled) - Below this value RSI will be considered oversold. This strategy will never close short positions during RSI oversold.
TimeStop.high: optional, default 0 (disabled) - Above this value RSI will be considered overbought. This strategy will never close long positions during RSI overbought.

TradingViewSignal.desc:
Strategy that buys or sells based on TradingView.com signals. Signals can be anything such as alerts from the CryptoScreener, alerts on a chart, indicator or buy/sell signals of a TradingView strategy - including your own Pine Script.
You should ensure that your signal messages include the words 'buy', 'sell' and 'close' to instruct WolfBot (using default settings, can be configured).
You can optionally specify a rate for a limit order in your TradingView alert message. To do this, you must include the text limit= - so a full alert could look like this: "some text, buy, limit=3500.5". To use market orders, write market=1 in your alert. Otherwise the rate of the last trade will be used. You can also specify a different trading amount by writing adding amount=123 to your message (in base currency, USD,...).
Use pl=500 to enter a minimum profit condition in your close signal (in base currency such as USD).
To use a custom limit, this strategy must trade directly, meaning 'tradeStrategy' must not be set. Otherwise the tradeStrategy decides the limit price once its indicator(s) match the desired trade direction.
You can use tradingview@wolfbot.org as email and an empty password for easier setup without your own email address. If you do this, you MUST include your Bot ID (for example WID1234) from the Status page.
TradingViewSignal.webhookUrl:
The Webhook URL you can enter in your TradingView alert to receive alerts with this bot. Webhooks are a faster alternative to Emails. Make sure you only enable of the two in your TradingView account.
This URL can not be changed.
TradingViewSignal.email:
The email address to check for TradingView alerts. TradingView alert emails must arrive in the INBOX folder of this account and be marked as "unread" for WolfBot to read them.
If you are using Gmail, please enable access for "less secure apps". See the TradingViewSignal strategy page on WolfBot.org for instructions.
TradingViewSignal.password: The corresponding password of the email account.
TradingViewSignal.host: optional, default automatic - The IMAP host of your email address.
TradingViewSignal.port: optional, default automatic - The IMAP port of your email address.
TradingViewSignal.tls: optional, default true - Whether to use TLS encryption to open your email inbox.
TradingViewSignal.checkMailSec: optional, default 45 seconds - How often your inbox shall be checked for new TradingView alerts.
TradingViewSignal.tradeDirection: optional, default 'both' - The direction in which this strategy shall act on signals from TradingView. Values: up|down|both
TradingViewSignal.buyWords: optional, default 'buy' - A list of words (case insensitive, separated by |) on which the strategy buys. It is recommended to fine-tune your alert messages first and only use this as fallback.
TradingViewSignal.sellWords: optional, default 'sell' - A list of words (case insensitive, separated by |) on which the strategy sells. It is recommended to fine-tune your alert messages first and only use this as fallback.
TradingViewSignal.closeWords:
optional, default 'close' - A list of words (case insensitive, separated by |) on which the strategy sells. If no close signals are used this strategy can still buy and (short) sell the same position without closing.
A close signal will always close the whole position size (regardless of your trading amount configuration) using a market order.
TradingViewSignal.alwaysAllowPosIncrease: optional, default false - Always allow increasing an existing position even if signal conditions such as "p/l" would prohibit it.
TradingViewSignal.forceMaker: optional. default false - Only place a maker order (not paying the higher taker fee).

TrailingStop.desc:
Strategy places a trailing stop (in percent) after a user-defined price level has been crossed.
This can be used both to take profit or as a stop-loss.
TrailingStop.rate: The rate at which this trailing stop is activated.
TrailingStop.comp: Does the market rate have to cross above or below that rate for the stop to get activated? Values: <|>
TrailingStop.trailingStopPerc: optional, default 0.5% - The trailing stop percentage that will be placed after the configured rate has been crossed.
TrailingStop.closePosition: optional, default always - Only close a position if its profit/loss is in that defined state. Values: always|profit|loss
TrailingStop.time: optional, default 0 = immediately - The time in seconds until the stop gets executed after the trailing stop has been reached.

Trendatron.desc: A strategy that follows waves of the chart by doing swing trading. It does this by combining 4 SMAs to Gann Swing indicator and adding VIX to check for volatility. Additionally it supports scalping, meaning it can buy more after sharp drops in price.
Trendatron.interval: The number of candles for SMAs to compute GannSwing.
Trendatron.stddevPriod: optional, default 20 - The number of candles for the VIX indicator to compute the standard derivation.

TrendlineScapler.desc:
Strategy has pre-configured support/resistance lines. Whenever the price gets close to that line we open a trade in the other direction (expecting a bounce back). Alternatively it can wait for breakouts at those price levels.
Works well with high leverage (10x - 20x) and RSI strategy for entry.
Works well on 1min candle size together with a trade strategy such as RSIOrderer or RSIScalpOrderer.
This strategy doesn't close positions. You must add a stop-loss and take profit strategy.
TrendlineScapler.supportLines: The price levels where we want to open long a position.
TrendlineScapler.resistanceLines: The price levels where we want to open short a position.
TrendlineScapler.tradeBreakout: optional, default false - A value of false means we will assume the price will bounce back within the trading range. If set to true we wait for the support/resistance to get broken and trade the breakout direction.
TrendlineScapler.expirationPercent: optional, default 3% - Only execute orders at price levels that are within x% of the set support/resistance lines.

TrendOscillator.desc:
Strategy that first checks for the current market trend using EMA crossover strategy.
It then emits buy/sell based on the Schaff Trend Cycle to only trade with the current trend. STC is a faster version of MACD that oscillates between 0 and 100. Sell signals are given when STC goes down from a high and buy signals when it comes up from a low.
This strategy also closes positions if an opposite trade signal occurs.
TrendOscillator.CrossMAType: optional, default EMA - The moving average type to use for identifying trend directions. Values: EMA|SMA|DEMA|WMA
TrendOscillator.short: optional, default 7 - Number of candles for the short EMA line.
TrendOscillator.long: optional, default 30 - Number of candles for the long EMA line.
TrendOscillator.low: optional, default 10 - Go long if STC goes up from this value.
TrendOscillator.high: optional, default 90 - Go short if STC goes down from this value.
TrendOscillator.closePositions: optional, default true - Close existing positions if an opposite signal occurs. Otherwise the position will be kept open until it is closed by another strategy (stop-loss, take-profit,...).
TrendOscillator.fast: optional, default 23 - The number of fast EMA candles.
TrendOscillator.slow: optional, default 50 - The number of slow EMA candles.
TrendOscillator.stcLength: optional, default 10 - How many candles STC will keep to compute MACD signal and STC candle data.
TrendOscillator.factor: optional, default 0.5 (should be <= 1.0) - A lower value means STC will forget historic data faster and be more responsive, thus doing more trades.

TriggerOrder.desc: Strategy that receives a order from another strategy (such as StopLoss or TakeProfit) and executes it once the threshold triggers. This strategy works with a small candle size (1min) while the strategy giving the order can have a larger candle size. This strategy doesn't have its own config, but instead uses some parameters from the pending order to be executed by it.

TripleTrend.desc:
A strategy that follows the current market trend by looking at 3 indicators: EMA crossover, ADX and MACD
A buy signal occurs when short EMA > long EMA, ADX and MACD histogram are trending up.
A sell signal occurs when short EMA < long EMA, ADX and MACD histogram are going down.
This strategy closes a position when the 2 EMAs cross the opposite direction. It can be used with an additional stop-loss or take profit strategy.
This strategy works well on 1h candles.
TripleTrend.CrossMAType: optional, default EMA - The moving average type to use for identifying trend directions. Values: EMA|SMA|DEMA
TripleTrend.shortEma: optional, default 13 - The number of candles to use for the short (fast) moving average.
TripleTrend.longEma: optional, default 48 - The number of candles to use for the long (slow) moving average.
TripleTrend.interval: optional, default 14 - Number of candles to use for ADX indicator.
TripleTrend.adxTrend: optional, default 20 - ADX will be considered trending when above this value.
TripleTrend.adxMaxTrend: optional, default 0 = disabled. ADX must be below this value. This prevents opening a position too late.
TripleTrend.short: optional, default 12 - Number of candles for the short EMA line of MACD.
TripleTrend.long: optional, default 26 - Number of candles for the long EMA line of MACD.
TripleTrend.signal: optional, default 9 - Number of candles for the MACD signal line (candles for EMA(short) - EMA(long)).
TripleTrend.closeOppositeCross: optional, default true - Close a position when the 2 EMAs cross the other direction.
TripleTrend.initialStop: optional, default false - Use the candle high/low of the current candle as initial stop on sell/buy actions.
TripleTrend.stopLongEma: optional, default true - Place a trailing stop at the rate of the long EMA.

VolumeProfiler.desc:
Strategy that waits for price to hit a high volume spot on the volume profile. Depending on 'tradeMode' it will then either:
- breakout: Wait until the price is at the end of this volume profile bar and then open a position with the current trend. This works well for opening positions for longer timeframes (multiple days to weeks).
- resistance: Immediately forward an order against the trend. You should have a 'tradeStrategy' such as 'RSIScalpOrderer' set on a smaller candleSize to delay the order execution until the trend slows down.
- both: Trade on breakout and resistance depending on where the current price is within the corresponding volume profile bar.
This strategy only opens positions. You need a stop-loss and/or take profit strategy.
VolumeProfiler.interval: optional, default 48. The number of candles to compute the volume profile and average volume from.
VolumeProfiler.volumeRows: optional default 24. The number of equally-sized price zones the price range is divided into.
VolumeProfiler.valueAreaPercent: optional, default 70%. The percentage of the total volume that shall make up the value area, meaning the price range where x% of the trades happen.
VolumeProfiler.minVolumeSpike: optional, default 1.1. The min volume compared to the average volume of the last 'interval' candles to open a position at a divergence.
VolumeProfiler.tradeMode: optional, default resistance. If we reach the volume profile bar with the highest volume, shall we wait for a bounce (trade the resistance) or trade a breakout? Values: breakout|resistance|both|watch|notify
VolumeProfiler.minVolumeSpikeBreakout: optional, default 2.1. If 'tradeMode' is set to 'both' the volume of the current candle has to be x times higher than the average volume to be considered a breakout. Otherwise trade resistance (open a position in the opposite direction).

VolumeSpikeDetector.desc: Detect if there is a spike in the trade volume of a coin. This usually means a sharp spike/drop is happening (especially for smaller Altcoins). This strategy works great at detecting fast pumps in a coin. It should be used with a small candle size such as 3-15min and a 'spikeFactor' according to your coin's volume profile changes. You should look at the chart and set the 'spikeFactor' value high enough so that this strategy only triggers about once a week for your coin. Take a look at VolumeSpikeDetectorLong for volume spikes in longer candle intervals (>= 12h) to detect if attention in a coin is rising.
VolumeSpikeDetector.spikeFactor: The minimum spike to open a position. Defined as x times higher than the average volume.
VolumeSpikeDetector.minVolBtc: The minimum volume for the current candle and average volume to prevent spikes near 0 trading volume. Defined in the base currency of your trading pair, usually BTC or USD.
VolumeSpikeDetector.historyCandle: optional, default 36 - How many candles to look back to compare if price and volume really are a spike. Set 0 to disable it.
VolumeSpikeDetector.tradeDirection: optional, default both - The direction in which this strategy shall open positions. 'notify' means you will only receive notifications to do a trade. 'watch' only computes the spike values for manual inspection. Values: up|down|both|notify|watch
VolumeSpikeDetector.minPriceChangePercent: optional, default 3.0 - The minimum percent the price has to change to confirm the volume spike and trade on it. If you are trading on small candles (5min) then a value of 1.5 or lower can also be a good setting. See PriceSpikeDetector for a strategy looking only at price spikes.
VolumeSpikeDetector.tradeOppositeDirection: optional, default false - If set to 'false' we don't trade if we have an open position in the other direction. 'true' means this strategy will always open a position.
VolumeSpikeDetector.strongRate: optional, default true - 'true' means this strategy will use a rate well above/below the current rate to ensure the order gets filled immediately during the spike. This is similar to submitting a market order.
VolumeSpikeDetector.onlyDailyTrend: optional, default true - Only trade when the spike is in the same direction as the 24h % price change.
VolumeSpikeDetector.keepCandleCount: optional, default 3 - The number of candles to keep to compute the average volume. Should be increased for small candle sizes such as 5min.

VolumeSpikeDetectorLong.desc: VolumeSpikeDetector version for longer intervals (daily) to detect if interest/attention in a coin is rising. Half day is also a good interval (especially since the bot might not run 24h without restart to collect enough data). This class only sends notifications and doesn't trade.
VolumeSpikeDetectorLong.spikeFactor: The minimum spike to send a trade notification. Defined as x times higher than the average volume.
VolumeSpikeDetectorLong.keepCandleCount: optional, default 3 - The number of candles to keep to compute the average volume.

VolumeSpikeStopper.desc: VolumeSpikeDetector version that closes a position immediately if there is a huge spike in volume (somebody dropping/buying lots of money) against an open position. Works well on 30min candle size.
VolumeSpikeStopper.spikeFactor: The minimum volume spike to close an open position if the price moves against our position. Defined as x times higher than the average volume.
VolumeSpikeStopper.keepCandleCount: optional, default 3 - The number of candles to keep to compute the average volume. Should be increased for small candle sizes such as 5min.

WaveOpener.desc: A WaveSurfer strategy that only opens positions. It will open long positions at the lowest candle of a wave and short positions at the highest candle of a wave. Works well with large and smaller candle sizes (15min up to 4h). See WaveSurfer strategy for more details.
WaveOpener.minSurfCandles: The minimum number of candles to keep a position open. Will usually be less than 'patternSize'.
WaveOpener.patternSize: optional, default 2 - The number of candles to keep to search for a pattern. 2 will mean we keep 4 candles (2 recent lows, 2 recent highs). 2 is a good value for larger candles above 1h. For fast trading on lower candles you should increase this to 5 or more.
WaveOpener.takeProfitCandleSize: optional, default 10 - The candle size in minutes of the candles this strategy uses to close a protitable position. At the end of the wave (consisting of bigger candles) it will schedule to close the position on the first candle of this small size moving against our position.
WaveOpener.historyPriceCandles: optional, default 6 - The number of candles to look for price history to decide if the bot should open long or short.
WaveOpener.lossPauseCandles: optional, default 0 - How many candles the bot shall pause trading after closing a position at a loss. The assumption is that the market is currently very irregular and no wave pattern can be detected.
WaveOpener.maxVolatility: This strategy will not enter or exit the market above this volatility. Can only be enabled if this is the only main strategy for your currency pair. A value > 0 means Bollinger Bandwidth has to be below this value. Remember that this means your volatility values will change a lot if you change the candle size (as do all unbound technical indicators).
WaveOpener.openBreakouts: optional default true - Open a new position even if the current candle isn't the min/max candle as long as it confirms with the current on EMA crossover trend.
WaveOpener.tradeDirection: optional, default both - The direction in which this strategy shall open positions. Values: up|down|both
WaveOpener.latestCandlePercent: optional, default 20% - How recent (in percent of 2*patternSize) the latest min/max candle has to be for the bot to open a position in the opposite direction (consider the wave to turn).
WaveOpener.longTrend: optional, default candles - How this strategy detects the long trend. 'ticker' means long trend will be set from daily ticker instead of pattern candles. Use 'up' or 'down' to force the direction of new positions this strategy will open at the right moment of a wave. Values: candles|ticker|up|down
WaveOpener.notifyBeforeExit: optional, default true - Send a notification 1 candle tick before exiting the market at a loss.
WaveOpener.onlyFollowIndicatorTrend: optional, default true - Only trade if the EMA indicator matches our candle pattern and candle trend. The EMA indicator trend is usually longer (more time back) that the candle trend.
WaveOpener.tradeIncreaseingTrendOnly: optional, default true - Only open a position if the EMA crossover line difference is increasing.
WaveOpener.CrossMAType: optional, default EMA - The moving average type to use for identifying trend directions. Values: EMA|SMA|DEMA
WaveOpener.short: optional, default 2 - Number of candles for the short EMA line.
WaveOpener.long: optional, default 7 - Number of candles for the long EMA line.
WaveOpener.interval: optional, default 14 - RSI interval for Falling Knife Protection: Don't buy/sell on overbought/oversold. The number of candles to use for RSI computation.
WaveOpener.low: optional, default 20 - Below this value RSI will be considered oversold.
WaveOpener.high: optional, default 80 - Above this value RSI will be considered overbought.
WaveOpener.MAType: optional, default 0 (SMA) - The moving average type of BollingerBands. BollingerBands indicator is being used to determine the market volatility by looking at Bollinger Bandwidth.

WaveStopper.desc: A simpler version of WaveSurfer that only closes positions once the market moves x candles in the other direction. The value of x depends on 'minSurfCandles' and 'patternSize'. This strategy can be used as a stop loss strategy. The candle size should be larger than when opening positions (>1h). See WaveSurfer strategy for more details.
WaveStopper.minSurfCandles: The minimum number of candles to keep a position open. Will usually be less than 'patternSize'.
WaveStopper.patternSize: optional, default 2 - The number of candles to keep to search for a pattern. 2 will mean we keep 4 candles (2 recent lows, 2 recent highs). 2 is a good value for larger candles above 1h. For fast trading on lower candles you should increase this to 5 or more.
WaveStopper.takeProfitCandleSize: optional, default 10 - The candle size in minutes of the candles this strategy uses to close a protitable position. At the end of the wave (consisting of bigger candles) it will schedule to close the position on the first candle of this small size moving against our position.
WaveStopper.historyPriceCandles: optional, default 6 - The number of candles to look for price history to decide if the bot should open long or short.
WaveStopper.lossPauseCandles: optional, default 0 - How many candles the bot shall pause trading after closing a position at a loss. The assumption is that the market is currently very irregular and no wave pattern can be detected.
WaveStopper.maxVolatility: This strategy will not enter or exit the market above this volatility. Can only be enabled if this is the only main strategy for your currency pair. A value > 0 means Bollinger Bandwidth has to be below this value. Remember that this means your volatility values will change a lot if you change the candle size (as do all unbound technical indicators).
WaveStopper.openBreakouts: optional default true - Open a new position even if the current candle isn't the min/max candle as long as it confirms with the current on EMA crossover trend.
WaveStopper.tradeDirection: optional, default both - The direction in which this strategy shall open positions. Values: up|down|both
WaveStopper.latestCandlePercent: optional, default 20% - How recent (in percent of 2*patternSize) the latest min/max candle has to be for the bot to open a position in the opposite direction (consider the wave to turn).
WaveStopper.longTrend: optional, default candles - How this strategy detects the long trend. 'ticker' means long trend will be set from daily ticker instead of pattern candles. Use 'up' or 'down' to force the direction of new positions this strategy will open at the right moment of a wave. Values: candles|ticker|up|down
WaveStopper.notifyBeforeExit: optional, default true - Send a notification 1 candle tick before exiting the market at a loss.
WaveStopper.onlyFollowIndicatorTrend: optional, default true - Only trade if the EMA indicator matches our candle pattern and candle trend. The EMA indicator trend is usually longer (more time back) that the candle trend.
WaveStopper.tradeIncreaseingTrendOnly: optional, default true - Only open a position if the EMA crossover line difference is increasing.
WaveStopper.CrossMAType: optional, default EMA - The moving average type to use for identifying trend directions. Values: EMA|SMA|DEMA
WaveStopper.short: optional, default 2 - Number of candles for the short EMA line.
WaveStopper.long: optional, default 7 - Number of candles for the long EMA line.
WaveStopper.interval: optional, default 14 - RSI interval for Falling Knife Protection: Don't buy/sell on overbought/oversold. The number of candles to use for RSI computation.
WaveStopper.low: optional, default 20 - Below this value RSI will be considered oversold.
WaveStopper.high: optional, default 80 - Above this value RSI will be considered overbought.
WaveStopper.MAType: optional, default 0 (SMA) - The moving average type of BollingerBands. BollingerBands indicator is being used to determine the market volatility by looking at Bollinger Bandwidth.

WaveSurfer.desc: A strategy that tries to identify patterns in the trade history of x candles in size (2*patternSize). Then it assumes this pattern will repeat times, adjust price levels and trades accordingly. Backfinder is a good tool to find the good candle size of patterns. Works well with high volume coins (ETH, LTC,..) but can fail badly with small coins because they have irregular spikes quite often. This is a more advanced version of the PatternRepeater strategy.
WaveSurfer.minSurfCandles: The minimum number of candles to keep a position open. Will usually be less than 'patternSize'.
WaveSurfer.patternSize: optional, default 2 - The number of candles to keep to search for a pattern. 2 will mean we keep 4 candles (2 recent lows, 2 recent highs). 2 is a good value for larger candles above 1h. For fast trading on lower candles you should increase this to 5 or more.
WaveSurfer.takeProfitCandleSize: optional, default 10 - The candle size in minutes of the candles this strategy uses to close a protitable position. At the end of the wave (consisting of bigger candles) it will schedule to close the position on the first candle of this small size moving against our position.
WaveSurfer.historyPriceCandles: optional, default 6 - The number of candles to look for price history to decide if the bot should open long or short.
WaveSurfer.lossPauseCandles: optional, default 0 - How many candles the bot shall pause trading after closing a position at a loss. The assumption is that the market is currently very irregular and no wave pattern can be detected.
WaveSurfer.maxVolatility: This strategy will not enter or exit the market above this volatility. Can only be enabled if this is the only main strategy for your currency pair. A value > 0 means Bollinger Bandwidth has to be below this value. Remember that this means your volatility values will change a lot if you change the candle size (as do all unbound technical indicators).
WaveSurfer.openBreakouts: optional default true - Open a new position even if the current candle isn't the min/max candle as long as it confirms with the current on EMA crossover trend.
WaveSurfer.tradeDirection: optional, default both - The direction in which this strategy shall open positions. Values: up|down|both
WaveSurfer.latestCandlePercent: optional, default 20% - How recent (in percent of 2*patternSize) the latest min/max candle has to be for the bot to open a position in the opposite direction (consider the wave to turn).
WaveSurfer.longTrend: optional, default candles - How this strategy detects the long trend. 'ticker' means long trend will be set from daily ticker instead of pattern candles. Use 'up' or 'down' to force the direction of new positions this strategy will open at the right moment of a wave. Values: candles|ticker|up|down
WaveSurfer.notifyBeforeExit: optional, default true - Send a notification 1 candle tick before exiting the market at a loss.
WaveSurfer.onlyFollowIndicatorTrend: optional, default true - Only trade if the EMA indicator matches our candle pattern and candle trend. The EMA indicator trend is usually longer (more time back) that the candle trend.
WaveSurfer.tradeIncreaseingTrendOnly: optional, default true - Only open a position if the EMA crossover line difference is increasing.
WaveSurfer.CrossMAType: optional, default EMA - The moving average type to use for identifying trend directions. Values: EMA|SMA|DEMA
WaveSurfer.short: optional, default 2 - Number of candles for the short EMA line.
WaveSurfer.long: optional, default 7 - Number of candles for the long EMA line.
WaveSurfer.interval: optional, default 14 - RSI interval for Falling Knife Protection: Don't buy/sell on overbought/oversold. The number of candles to use for RSI computation.
WaveSurfer.low: optional, default 20 - Below this value RSI will be considered oversold.
WaveSurfer.high: optional, default 80 - Above this value RSI will be considered overbought.
WaveSurfer.MAType: optional, default 0 (SMA) - The moving average type of BollingerBands. BollingerBands indicator is being used to determine the market volatility by looking at Bollinger Bandwidth.

UnlimitedMargin.desc:
Strategy that always closes positions at a profit. This is done by increasing the position size.
To be able to always increase your position size as required you should set about 0.5 - 1.0 % of your total available trading capital for this strategy to begin its first trade. Hence the name "unlimited" margin. This strategy is intended to be used for margin trading.
This strategy is optimized for the top 20 coins by market cap. It should not be used with other coins!
The first trade of this strategy will be AGAINST the current trend of your chosen indicator and this position will be increased on successive indicator highs/lows.
This strategy will open and close existing positions, so don't combine it with take-profit or stop-loss strategies to avoid unintended side effects (positions closing at a loss).
Keep in mind that during Backtesting trading fees are deducted which might still decrease your total balance if 'profitTargetPercent' isn't high enough and during real-time trading exchanges will charge you interest rates for margin trading.
UnlimitedMargin.profitTargetPercent: optional, default 1.5%. The net profit of your total margin position (opened during multiple trades) when it shall be closed.
UnlimitedMargin.interval: optional, default 15. The number of candles to use for the high/low calculation to compute the entry indicator value from.
UnlimitedMargin.minVolumeSpike: optional, default 1.1. The min volume compared to the average volume of 'interval' candles to open a first position.
UnlimitedMargin.entryIndicator: default RSI. The indicator to use to open and increase a position.
UnlimitedMargin.low: optional, default 28. Only go long if the entry indicator is below this value.
UnlimitedMargin.high: optional, default 72. Only go short if the entry indicator is above this value.
UnlimitedMargin.maxGoLongPrice: optional, default 0 = any price. The maximum price to open a long position.
UnlimitedMargin.minGoShortPrice: optional, default 0 = any price. The minimum price to open a short position.

WeekPredictor.desc:
Strategy that follows the weekly trend of the market. This strategy crawls various data feeds (including fundamentals) additionally to doing some Technical Analyisis. Therefore backtesting is not available for this strategy. You may still run it in paper trading mode if you are interested in its results without investing any money.
It works well on 1h candles and closes positions only if they are in profit. Consider adding a stop-loss strategy.
This strategy is optimized for the top 20 coins by market cap using USD as base currency and should not be used for smaller coins.
WeekPredictor.tradeMode: optional, default both - If this strategy shall open long and/or short position. In watch mode it will only display market information and send notifications (if enabled). Values: long|short|both|watch
WeekPredictor.trailingCloseMode: optional, default profit. Close an existing position by placing a trailing stop with trailingStopPerc if the global market orderbooks turn against it. Values: always|never|profit|loss
WeekPredictor.priceReachedPercent: optional, default 0.1% - How close the price must be to the reference rate to be considered reached.
WeekPredictor.interval: optional, default 48 - The number of candles to compute the volume profile and average volume from. Also the number of data points to keep in history.
WeekPredictor.volumeRows: The number of equally-sized price zones the price range is divided into.
WeekPredictor.valueAreaPercent: default 60% - The percentage of the total volume that shall make up the value area, meaning the price range where x% of the trades happen.
WeekPredictor.minVolumeSpike: optional, default 1.1 - The min volume compared to the average volume of the last 'interval' candles to open a position.
WeekPredictor.askBidRatioThreshold: optional, default 1.0 - The required ratio of asks/bids within 5% of the current price in the orderbook. Short positions will only be opened when the ratio is greater than this setting and longs only when it is lower.
WeekPredictor.closePosition: optional, default always - Only close a position if its profit/loss is in that defined state. Values: always|profit|loss
WeekPredictor.trailingStopPerc: optional, default 0.5% - The trailing stop percentage that will be placed once the computed profit target of the strategy has been reached.
WeekPredictor.time: optional, default 0 = immediately - The time in seconds until the stop gets executed after the trailing stop has been reached.
WeekPredictor.feed: optional, default BitmexMarketData - The exchange feed to use to get liquidations from. Values: BitmexMarketData
WeekPredictor.currencyPairs: optional, default ["USD_BTC"] - The currency pairs to subscribe to for liquidation data.
WeekPredictor.notifyVolumeChangeAssets: optional, default 0 (disabled) - Send a notification when the order of the top x assets by 24h volume changed.
WeekPredictor.notifyMarketCapChangeAssets: optional, default 0 (disabled) - Send a notification when the order of the top x assets by USD market cap changed.

VolumeProfileControl.desc:
Strategy that waits until the current price is away a certain percentage from the highest Volume Profile bar and then opens a position under the assumption the price will diverge back to that price level again.
This is a medium/fast trading strategy designed for 5min to 30min candles in consolidating (not trending) markets.
This strategy only opens positions. You need a stop-loss and/or take profit strategy.
VolumeProfileControl.minPercentDivergence: default 1.8. The min percentage the current price has to diverge from the highest volume profile bar to open a position.
VolumeProfileControl.interval: default 24. The number of candles to compute the volume profile and average volume from.
VolumeProfileControl.volumeRows: default 24. The number of equally-sized price zones the price range is divided into.
VolumeProfileControl.valueAreaPercent: default 70%. The percentage of the total volume that shall make up the value area, meaning the price range where x% of the trades happen.
VolumeProfileControl.minVolumeSpike: default 1.1. The min volume compared to the average volume of the last 'interval' candles to open a position.
VolumeProfileControl.aroonReached: default 80. If AroonUp or AroonDown are above this value the market is assumed trending and this strategy will not open positions.

StopHunter.desc:
Strategy that keeps track of price highs and lows and opens a position with the current market trend after a possible stop-loss hunt took place. A stop-loss hunt is detected by a high volume candle with a long tail making a new price high/low. The current market trend is detected by the crossing of 2 EMAs.
This is a medium/ designed for 60min candles in trending markets.
This strategy only opens positions. You need a stop-loss and/or take profit strategy.
StopHunter.candleTailPercent: optional, default 20% - The minimum percentage relative to the candle body ( abs(open - close) ) the candle high/low has to be long.
StopHunter.CrossMAType: optional, default EMA - The indicator to use to look for line cross signals to identify an up/down trend. Values: EMA|DEMA|SMA
StopHunter.short: optional, default 7 - The number of candles for the short moving average.
StopHunter.long: optional, default 30 - The number of candles for the long moving average.
StopHunter.interval: optional, default 24 - The number of candles to compute the average volume from and to check for price highs/lows.
StopHunter.minVolumeSpike: optional, default 1.5 - The min volume compared to the average volume of the last 'interval' candles to open a position.

FishingNet.desc:
A Strategy that starts buying amounts on/after a peak as the price declines. It starts with small amounts and increases the size of the orders as the price goes down (thus dividing the total order size into chunks). As the prices falls into this "fishing net", our losses increase, but since we repeatedly bought the same amount, our average buy price is lower and it doesn't take long to get a profit at any point as soon as the market turns.
This strategy opens and closes positions but you may still add additional TakeProfit/StopLoss strategies.
FishingNet.fishingMode: optional, default trend - In which direction shall this strategy open positions? 'trend' means the strategy will decide automatically based on the current MACD trend. Values: up|down|trend
FishingNet.percentage: optional, default 15% - How many percent of the total trading balance shall be used for the first trade and on each trade to increase the position size.
FishingNet.maxPosIncreases: optional, default 7 - How many times this strategy shall increase an existing position at most. Note that raising this value can cause your strategy to trade with more than your configured total trading balance.
FishingNet.scaleOutPerc: optional, default 0.0 (use the same amount for all orders) - This value allows you to increase each buy/sell order of numOrdersPerSide by a certain percentage. This helps to move the average rate of all your orders (and thus the break-even rate) in your favor.
FishingNet.tradingAmountIncreaseFactor: optional, default 1.1 - The factor with which your trading amount will be increased on each trade after opening a position. So the total capital of trade n to increase an existing position will be: tradeTotalBtc * percentage * tradingAmountIncreaseFactor * n
FishingNet.profitPercent: optional, default 2.1% - After the total position size reached this profit the position will no longer be increased. Instead a trailing stop with 'trailingStopPerc' will be placed.
FishingNet.interval: optional, default 24 - The number of candles to compute the volume profile and average volume from. Also the number of data points to keep in history.
FishingNet.volumeRows: default 24 - The number of equally-sized price zones the price range is divided into.
FishingNet.valueAreaPercent: default 60% - The percentage of the total volume that shall make up the value area, meaning the price range where x% of the trades happen.
FishingNet.minVolumeSpike: optional, default 1.7 - The min volume compared to the average volume of the last 'interval' candles to open a position.
FishingNet.minVolumeSpikePosInc: optional, default 1.1 - The min volume when increasing an existing position compared to the average volume of the last 'interval' candles to open a position.
FishingNet.closePosition: optional, default profit - Only close a position by placing the trailing stop if its profit/loss is in that defined state.
FishingNet.trailingStopPerc: optional, default 0.5% - The trailing stop percentage that will be placed once the computed profit target of the strategy has been reached.
FishingNet.time: optional, default 30 (0 = immediately) - The time in seconds until the stop gets executed after the trailing stop has been reached.
FishingNet.trendIndicator: optional, default EMA. The indicator to determine the current market trend. Only used in fishingMode 'trend'. Values: MACD|EMA|SMA|DEMA
FishingNet.short: optional, default 10 - The number of candles for the short EMA of the MACD indicator (or the moving average of trendIndicator).
FishingNet.long: optional, default 26 - The number of candles for the long EMA of the MACD indicator (or the moving average of trendIndicator).
FishingNet.signal: optional, default 9 - The number of candles for the signal line of the MACD line (short EMA - long EMA).
FishingNet.bollingerBandProtection: optional, default true - Only open new positions within Bollinger Bands to protect against volatile markets where it is more likely that our stop-loss will get hit.
FishingNet.feed: optional, default BitmexMarketData - The exchange feed to use to get liquidations from. This is not available during backtesting, so results might differ. Values: BitmexMarketData
FishingNet.currencyPairs: optional, default ["USD_BTC"] - The currency pairs to subscribe to for liquidation data.
FishingNet.supportLines: The price levels where we want to open long a position. Leave empty to open at any price level.
FishingNet.resistanceLines: The price levels where we want to open short a position. Leave empty to open at any price level.
FishingNet.expirationPercent: optional, default 3% - Only execute orders at price levels that are within x% of the set support/resistance lines.

FishingStraight.desc:
A Strategy that repeatedly buys/sells amounts in the same direction. It starts with small amounts and increases the size of the orders as the price goes down (thus dividing the total order size into chunks). If the market keeps moving against an existing position, our losses increase, but since we repeatedly increased our position size, our average buy price is close to the current price and it doesn't take long to get a profit at any point as soon as the market turns.
This strategy opens and closes positions but you may still add additional TakeProfit/StopLoss strategies.
FishingStraight.fishingMode: optional, default trend - In which direction shall this strategy open positions? 'trend' means the strategy will decide automatically based on the current MACD trend. Values: up|down|trend
FishingStraight.percentage: optional, default 10% - How many percent of the total trading balance shall be used for the first trade and on each trade to increase the position size.
FishingStraight.maxPosIncreases: optional, default 45 - How many times this strategy shall increase an existing position at most. Note that raising this value can cause your strategy to trade with more than your configured total trading balance.
FishingStraight.minPriceChangeIncrease: optional, default 1.0% - How much the price must move against an open position to increase its size.
FishingStraight.tradingAmountIncreaseFactor: optional, default 1.05 - The factor with which your trading amount will be increased on each trade after opening a position. So the total capital of trade n to increase an existing position will be: tradeTotalBtc * percentage * tradingAmountIncreaseFactor * n
FishingStraight.profitPercent: optional, default 1.1% - After the total position size reached this profit the position will no longer be increased. Instead a trailing stop with 'trailingStopPerc' will be placed.
FishingStraight.closePosition: optional, default profit - Only close a position by placing the trailing stop if its profit/loss is in that defined state.
FishingStraight.trailingStopPerc: optional, default 0.05% - The trailing stop percentage that will be placed once the computed profit target of the strategy has been reached.
FishingStraight.time: optional, default 0 (0 = immediately) - The time in seconds until the stop gets executed after the trailing stop has been reached.
FishingStraight.short: optional, default 10 - The number of candles for the short EMA of the MACD indicator.
FishingStraight.long: optional, default 26 - The number of candles for the long EMA of the MACD indicator.
FishingStraight.signal: optional, default 9 - The number of candles for the signal line of the MACD line (short EMA - long EMA).

HullSwinger.desc:
Strategy that detects swings based on the Hull MA together with DEMA and Bollinger Bands percent B value.
This swing trading strategy is meant for short term daytrading. It works well on candle sizes of 5min - 120min.
It will open and close positions. You may still add a stop-loss or take-profit strategy.
HullSwinger.tradeDirection: optional, default both - The direction in which this strategy shall open positions. Values: up|down|both
HullSwinger.interval: optional, default 9 - The number of candles to use for the Hull MA computation.
HullSwinger.swingBackTicks: optional, default 1 - How many candles have to at least pass to trade again in the opposite direction.
HullSwinger.minProfitClose:
optional, default 0 (disabled) - The minimum profit a position must have to close it (and open an opposite position) on a new swing.
The amount is specified in base currency (USD for USD_XXX pair). Increasing this value can be useful in sideways markets to wait for the next swing and keep the position open until it is profitable.
HullSwinger.N: optional, default 20 - The time period for MA of BollingerBands.
HullSwinger.K: optional, default 2 - The factor for upper/lower band of BollingerBands.
HullSwinger.MAType: optional, default 0 (SMA) - The moving average type of BollingerBands.

MarketMakerOffset.desc:
Strategy that acts as a market maker by placing 2 corresponding buy/sell limit orders a certain percentage away from each other. You can configure a fixed percentage or place them as far away as possible within the orderbook (while staying closer to the last trade price than any other orders).
This strategy can also pause market making during quick price movements.
This strategy can also issue multiple open buy/sell order pairs - each one a configured percentage further apart.
You must run this strategy alone, meaning without any StopLoss, take-profit or trade strategy.
MarketMakerOffset.makerMode: optional, default fixed - Fixed means we place orders at percent steps away from the last trade price. Book means orders get placed as far away as possible in the orderbook (going inwards towards the market price) to not ruin potential spread opportunities. Values: fixed|book
MarketMakerOffset.priceSpreadPerc: optional, default 0.35% - How far away from the last trade price buy/sell orders shall be placed in 'fixed' mode. In 'book' mode this is the minumum spread the orderbook must have to place orders.
MarketMakerOffset.numOrdersPerSide: optional, default 1 - The number of buy and sell orders with the same amount and same price distance that shall be placed. In 'book' mode there can only be 1 order on each side.
MarketMakerOffset.orderExpiryHours: optional, default 24 (0 = disabled) - After how many hours orders that only had 1 side filled (buy or sell) shall be cancelled.
MarketMakerOffset.exitOrderThreshold: optional, default 1 - If this is > 0 the WolfBot will cancel all opposite-direction orders orders once exitOrderThreshold buy/sell orders have been filled and place a single take-profit order to exit the market at priceSpreadPerc. If this is 0 WolfBot will keep all orders on both sides until they are filled or expired.
MarketMakerOffset.scaleOutPerc: optional, default 0.0 (use the same amount for all orders) - This value allows you to increase each buy/sell order of numOrdersPerSide by a certain percentage. This helps to move the average rate of all your orders (and thus the break-even rate) in your favor.
MarketMakerOffset.stopLossPerc: optional, default 0.0 (disabled). Place a stop-loss threshold in percent (from the 1st entry rate) at which this strategy will cancel all orders and exit an existing position at a loss.
MarketMakerOffset.bollingerBandProtection: optional, default true - Only place order pairs within Bollinger Bands to protect against volatile markets where it is more likely that only 1 order will get filled.
MarketMakerOffset.idleMinutesOnLiquidation: optional, default 2min - Don't place orders for this time after a liquidation occurred.
MarketMakerOffset.removeOrderPairsOnLiquidation: optional, default true - Remove open order pairs when a liquidation occurred.
MarketMakerOffset.feed: optional, default BitmexMarketData - The exchange feed to use to get liquidations from. This is not available during backtesting, so results might differ. Values: BitmexMarketData
MarketMakerOffset.currencyPairs: optional, default ["USD_BTC"] - The currency pairs to subscribe to for liquidation data.
MarketMakerOffset.forceMaker: optional. default false - Only place a maker order (not paying the higher taker fee).

TrailingStopReverseEntry.desc:
Strategy that has pre-configured support/resistance lines. When the price crosses such a line we place a trailing stop to trade in the other direction (expecting a bounce back). This trade will only happen if the entry price (when the trailing stop gets executed) is still above resistance (resp. below support).
Works well with high leverage (10x - 20x) and RSI strategy for entry.
Works well on 1min candle size together with a trade strategy such as RSIOrderer or RSIScalpOrderer.
This strategy doesn't close positions. You must add a stop-loss and take profit strategy.
TrailingStopReverseEntry.supportLines: The price levels below we want to open long a position.
TrailingStopReverseEntry.resistanceLines: The price levels above we want to open short a position.
TrailingStopReverseEntry.trailingStopGoLong: optional, default 2% - Place a trailing stop to go long if price reverses up and is still below the support line.
TrailingStopReverseEntry.trailingStopGoShort: optional, default 2% - Place a trailing stop to go short if price reverses down and is still above the resistance line.
TrailingStopReverseEntry.expirationPercent: optional, default 4%. Only execute orders at price levels that are within x% of the set support/resistance lines.

Spread.desc:
Arbitrage strategy that computes the average price across exchanges. If the price is x% higher/lower than avg on exchanges:
1. buy at the cheaper exchange and (short) sell at the expensive exchange
2. close positions after price difference moves x% closer
Spread.spreadEntry: How many % the market spread between the 2 exchanges has to be to open positions on both of them.
Spread.spreadTarget:
Targeted profit in %. This takes trading fees into account. See the 'tradingFees' setting.
Positions will be closed according to this equation: spreadExit = spreadEntry - 4*fees - spreadTarget -> will usually negative, meaning prices flipped
Spread.trailingSpreadStop: After reaching spreadTarget, place a trailing stop to exit the market. Set this to 0 to exit immediately.
Spread.statelessArbitrage:
optional, default false. Use only 1 trade per exchange (buy on the lower, sell on the higher) and don't keep an open margin position until the spread decreases.
Enabling this setting means configuration such as 'trailingSpreadStop' will be ignored since there are no trades to close the open arbitrage position.

Leg.desc:
Arbitrage strategy using limit orders with 1 leg "standing" on the current price rate of the higher-volume exchange. Thereby offering liquidity to the lower-volume exchange by copying the orderbook.
Also see MarketMakerOffset strategy for a similar way of market making while only being connected to 1 exchange.
Leg.copySide: default "bids" - Which side of the orderbook shall be mirrored. Values: bids|asks
Leg.priceAddPercent: default 0.05% - The percentage the prices on the market we make shall differ from the leg exchange we mirror the orderbook from. This is our profit. Therefore this value must be higher than your trading fees on both exchanges combined plus the maximum possible rounding up loss depending on each exchange's minimum trade tick size (see bookDepthPerSide).
Leg.bookDepthPerSide:
default 20 - The price-depth of bids and asks that shall be mirrored. It is measured as the number of orderbook price-level entries, so depending on the minimum trade tick size of each exchange the actual number of orders might be different on both exchanges. Yet they both with go the same price-depth into the bids and asks.
Keep in mind that increasing this value will increase the number of trade API requests to the smaller exchange, so be sure your request limit is sufficiently high.
Leg.maxAmountPerOrder: optional, default tradeTotalBtc - The max amount in base currency of a single order. The actual amount will be min(maxAmountPerOrder, amount on leg exchange). This value can't be higher than tradeTotalBtc.
Leg.maxTotalExposure: optional, default 500.000 - Max amount in base currency of all open orders combined.
Leg.minDelayAdjustOrdersMs: default 300 ms - The minimum delay in milliseconds before updating orders.

DEMA.desc: Strategy that updates of lending interest rates based on the value of the DEMA indicator.
DEMA.CrossMAType: optional, default DEMA - The moving average type to compute the average interest rate from. The value of this will be the interest rate we start placing loans at. Values: EMA|SMA|DEMA
DEMA.long: optional, default 7 - Number of candles for the DEMA line.
DEMA.autoSensitivity: optional, default false - Automatically adjust how many % above the DEMA the interest rate should be on highly volatile markets.
DEMA.deltaPercent: optional, default 0% - Increase the minimum lending rate by %x above DEMA. Use negative values to decrease it.
DEMA.MAType: optional, default 0 (SMA) - The moving average type of BollingerBands. BollingerBands indicator is being used to determine the market volatility by looking at Bollinger Bandwidth.
